item.title: New position in Leeds
item.dc:creator: CC-BY
item.description:
Today I started a new position in the EEGManyLabs core team with Yuri Pavlov, Faisal Mushtaq and Jasper van den Bosch. I'll be based at the Immersive Cognition Lab at the University of Leeds.

Looking forward to more focussed Open Science work, Big EEG Data, and the foggy Yorkshire moors!

item.title: New contribution: Eye Tracking support for MNE Python
item.dc:creator: CC-BY
item.description:
Last year I got a scholarship to participate in the MNE-Python 2022 Code Sprint. Besides some fixes and work in the documentation my main goal was to enable MNE to read and support Eye Tracking data.

We now merged a first big PR (thanks to Scott Huberty for joining me and pushing us forward!):

MNE now has a dedicated class for eye tracking data and can import SR Research's proprietary ASCII files (or work with data in numpy arrays). Check out the first tutorials here and here ;)

item.title: Participation in MNE-Python's New Developers Code Sprint
item.dc:creator: CC-BY
item.description:
I was selected to participate in MNE-Python's 2022 New Developers Code Sprint :)

Besides some other ideas, my main goal will be Eye Tracking support for MNE. I had contributed before, but am looking forward to a week of learning and coding with the core devs!

item.title: New contribution: Frequency-tagging (SSVEP/ASSR) tutorial for MNE Python
item.dc:creator: CC-BY
item.description:
My new tutorial on how to work with frequency-tagged data in MNE-Python has just been merged! Check it out here!

This is a small spin-off from my current methods-paper on the effect of experimental conditions in EEG studies. Here we used an auditory (ASSR) stimulus as a proxy measure for EEG recording quality. Stay tuned for the preprint.

Thanks to Evgenii Kalenkovich for working together on the tutorial :)
